description:
Polari is the best, most simple IRC client I have ever used.

Builtin paste is amazing!
Looks good and easy to use but some features are missing, like rooms list NickServ support.
I wish it had NickServ support and then five starer!

The word "simple" is misleading. This "app" looks like a school project made at the weekends by some teenagers. It's dumb. Altho you can actually connect to a network and chat in some rooms, you cannot do anything else without knowing tons of IRC commands.
summary: It's not simple, it is lacking most basic features

description: Not such useful

Polari is really nice to look at and very well integrated into the Gnome ecosystem. However, there are still many missing features for it to be a true replacement for most users. At the time of this review, server passwords are hard to use, NickServ isn't supported for automatic login and a lot of more advanced commands are missing.

In a few versions, this could become a really good replacement for older clients like Hexchat, for those who want a unified desktop experience.
summary: A good, but lacking, IRC client for Gnome

description: The best IRC client ever.
If I could specify the commands it automatically sends to the nickname server on startup, the feature wouldn't be annoyingly broken on some servers and I'd like this client way more.

This is just another GNOME toy that I really want to like, but just can't. I could deal with not having nickserv support, but what I can't deal with is when this client uses my full name (visible if I /whois myself) and doesn't give me any options to change this (at least that I can see) or any clear and well-defined options menu at all.

Much like the GNOME web browser. I want to love this because it integrates into GNOME so beautifully. I just can't because of how many features (ones that actually matter to the functionality of the application, I mean) it lacks.
A true GNOME IRC client. Something we all thought impossible.
summary: Every release is better than the last!

description: It's a very convenient and intuitive way to communicate via IRC, looking forward to the future!
summary: Excellent work! My favorite IRC client!

description: In a typical GNOME fashion, the design, polish and the integration is incredible by Linux standards but unfortunately you likely won't use the app for long; the lack of functionality presents itself rather quickly.
summary: Polish: amazing. Features: not so much

description: I would recommend this software to everyone! I wonder why this does not come pre-installed?
Very Good!
Not able to set custom SSL port config. I might be missing something, but I could not find any advanced settings when adding a new network.
I'm new with this App, but i think is quite beautiful and do the job.
No way to customise your username or IRC servers you want to connect to. Looks very shiny but it is ultimately useless to me.
It would show one message from a room on freenode and hang. No support to connect to alternate networks that work fine with HexChat or Pidgin. Not worth the time to install and try.
Many of us use SASL to authenticate nick to freenode. Polari doesn't give any option for that. :(
summary: Overall great but lacks SASL auth

description: This app is broken even on startup. It won't add a chatroom at all
Couldn't get past nickserv registration without raging, this is so terribly designed.
On openSUSE Tumbleweed, the application doesn't open any window. It starts loading, but then nothing pops up.
summary: It doesn't work with openSUSE Tumbleweed

description: Polari isn't a good IRC Client lack most of the features you need, you can't even ask the room list of the server.

Beautiful app but basic functionality is not yet available. Since irc commands are yet to be fully supported, basic features like changing your user name are a challenge. 

Dealing with servers that require authentication becomes a chore if your nickname is already taken. Full nickserv support is a must. For now the experience is just irritating.
Like the title says, it looks great, but is seriously lacking in features. Use something else unless you are happy with not needing to do anything but chat.
it needs some notifications control to get where others are , and some themes and coloring to make it easy to use .
summary: good with some room for improvement

description: Nice look and functionality
This is a great app to join to community.

well, i wanted to love this program. i really loved the simplicity of it, and i especially loved the layout of it... but it got me muted or something on the #Ubuntu server. im thinking its because even though it logs you in automatically and you can keep it running in the background, when your screen goes to sleep it seems to log you out or something, then re log you in when the screen turns on (over and over again) and that can get annoying in a server where it shows someone constantly logging in and out.
summary: Nice GUI, Follows the Gnome standards...but wait

description:
too many bugs
also hangs
Connecting 10 channels may spend all your day. Worst networking.
The interface is very clean, and removes a lot of the distractions of other apps. I really like that.
summary: Simple and clean, works quite well

description: Polari is a simple IRC based on GNOME. It has good integration with GNOME Environment.
summary: Polari is one of the best IRC based on GNOME

description: This app crashes when trying to load.

The plus is that it's well integrated with the Gnome - it allows to display the received message's text in the notification. Also, it is nice looking and consents with the Gnome interface.
At the same time, it lacks functionality. There is no way to setup the nickname before entering the room, the designers made the strange decision to display sending time only for the first message. No options to raise a notification on a specific event like the new message in the room, user connection etc.
A lot of the reviews here are old and complaining about a lack of features, but in the last two years a lot has changed and the software has matured. Including with NickServ support.
summary: Easy to use & has come a long way recently

description: It has new clear interface. But also totally destructed IRC user experience, low performance, freezes, ugly italic-capitalized popups in /HELP, meaningless development for people who never user IRC to grow in them an aversion to this protocol.
I would like the app to no longer have NickServ automatically message me periodically.
summary: I can't find the config file

description: The reviews saying it doesn’t are out of date.

It is hard to enter Custom connection information. It takes too much time to figure out what is what. If you will use for popular servers such as freenode etc. then this can be good. Also it doesn't allow to connect to server unless you enter a channel name.
Buggy and doesn't even support SASL. Disappointing for a GNOME app.

The GNOME developers were once again being really platonic and lazy when they made this app. It does what it's supposed to do, and there it ends. It might have been a better app if it had more features, for example:
- NickServ account support
- More settings
summary: Not the best IRC client I've ever had

description: Good design but not functional

When I was listing the chanels the polari was feezing.
The UI is not intuitive
work as expected with nice integration with GNOME desktop .
I wanted DCC but :(

Only tried this because it's one of the few programs installed on a base Fedora 34 install. Couldn't connect to my ZNC bouncer, the options to do any of the configuration I need simply do not exist. There seem to be workarounds if you configure it from an entirely different application, but that's a ridiculous requirement. Just give me real options, hide them behind a little "advanced options" button if you must, but at least suggest to me where I'm supposed to go for this.
summary: No options for a user that is even slightly technical

description: After trying to add a custom network ircs://irc.libera.chat:6697/#fedora-coreos , the Polari client keeps crashing when I try to open it. I cannot even open the client just to remove the custom network and restore things to normal. Would not recommend.
summary: Repeated crashes after attempting to add custom network

description: It looks like they have released an incomplete product, for me it only leads to annoyance.
It works great, but I cannot mute notifications from NickServ in version 42
I like the way GNOME has core apps and they are named by the developersinstead after the desktop. Works and very easy to setup. Looking forward to more functions and updates.
Looks good but I cannot cha ge my nickname. i am using a pinephone wuth Arch plasma, and jt dies not seem ti ket me do that.

You might have seen all the negative reviews and think polari is bad. However, half of the negative reviews are because of NickServ. They say its not supported but they added nickserv support. No more /msg, just auto login. It's also very polished like any GNOME app.
Don't let all the negative reviews put you off. For me, personally, it works fine on Fedora 39. Integrates nicely with Gnome!

I am offended that trash language is installed on my pc (not to mention unknowing families). It is highly inaproperate to include fowle language within a "game" or otherwise, program. Take this down now and clean it up. People who do this have no regard for family values what's so ever.
Quite a lot of things don't work, but I won't report bugs because I don't have so much time
It is aimed at Gnome chat, but it lacks much of why I started to use IRC decades ago. It is a start, but I hope that it is not the finish.
The app seems to work very well for me. I have no complaints. It would be nice though if it could support\render latex.
The app does not scroll to the bottom when I send a new message. This is basics.
It locks up hard using X11
Everything is working ok

I wasn't sure about this app considering the other reviews, but I figured they might've fixed the nickserv issues by now and it wasn't a big time investment to find out. Plus, it'd be nice to have a little native gnome app for IRC. Aside from the minor hiccup that I had to enter in tilde.chat's address (the supplied one didn't add itself to the sidebar), it works perfectly fine! And as far as that goes, for tilde.chat I just entered the address and my nick, and that was that. Nice little clean IRC app.
summary: Works with NickServ now, so I'm happy with it

description:
I thought I'd give this a try since Srain (still) doesn't support saving user data across sessions with a GUI menu, nor does it have dark mode support.
First impressions: The app is beautiful. Very well-designed, truly a first-class citizen of the GNOME platform. That, and it actually appears to be able to save data without having to edit a text file somewhere in my system. Great!
That's about where my good experience ends, however. I couldn't figure out how to change my nickname, as the menu to edit it is completely non-actionable for some reason. It's not at all clear why. Using /nick didn't work either. This app should let you select your nick on startup like Srain, as most IRC users don't want their computer login (often their real name) to be their default IRC nick.
It hardly matters, because after pressing the + button and joining the GNOME channel, the app crashed and can no longer start. At all. I've uninstalled and reinstalled, and I'm not going to track down every file that Polari propagates across my system, so I suppose I just won't ever use it again by force.
I really wanted to like this app. I really did. But I am physically unable to use it at this point. Such a shame. Filing a bug report and checking back in a year or two...
I can't change the name on the app. It doesn't apply the changes, it always uses the computer account name.
You cant log in to Libera Chat using NickServ, or even use plain SASL. Direct messages to other Nicks are missing.
Its a beautifully simple app and works really well. My only gripe is it's too simple and lacks configurability and complex irc commands.

Good design but huge privacy risk, it changes my nick to my local username.
Even when you provide an username it changes it back after connecting to the irc server 2-2-2019
summary: Good design but huge privacy risk!

description: Tiene una interfaz muy sencilla y es fácil de adaptarse, el diseño ayuda mucho a simplemente estar enfocado en las salas y ofrece la información necesaria sobre los ususarios y de forma ordenada. Es mi aplicación predeterminada para el IRC.
summary: Me encanta su simplicidad y nunca me ha fallado

description:
Muy bonita, simple y minimalista. También está muy bien ordenada, pero no consigo sacar listas de canales de los servidores IRC, y tampoco hay info por la web...

Podría ser grandiosa la aplicación.
summary: Si no sabes donde quieres ir, estás perdido

description: es ororoso los odio
para irc-hispano me funciono, solo con poner el servidor
falta un boton de ajustes, para el texto, diferenciar por colores usuarios.... etc. en si va bien, pero con esta gran carencia y algunas veces se desconecta
- not enough options .. like hexchat . no password identification with nickserve ....

I don't understand why "gilles" said that password is not used with NickServ... After login to nickserv, Polari ask if you want to keep the password...
t works, no problem for me

Prise en main fastidieuse, n'hésitez pas à consulter les documentations des distributions que vous utilisez pour la configurer.
Après configuration, je trouve que c'est une application client IRC qui est légère et s'intègre dans GNOME puisque c'est une application native de cet environnement.

Failed to correctly join and see users at #freedesktop-sdk on freenode, showing an empty channel instead.
No easy way to see the logs and understand why.
After some searches for a channel, the app locked up and had to be killed.
summary: Simple is good, when it works

description: хуйня редкостная
Новый дизайн, новое видение, интересный и простой. Ничего не напрягает. Классно.
Хорошее рабочее приложение
Polari 界面简洁，使用方便，是理想的 IRC 客户端。
RT，还是更喜欢终端下的weechat
summary: 过于简介，连SASL都无法使用

description: 没什么用
挺不错的，自带应用，尝试了下不错，好用
summary: 挺不错的，自带应用，尝试了下不错，好用
